Number of times an agent suspects another as failed while probing during gossip protocol

This increments whenever a Consul agent in client mode makes an RPC request to a Consul server. This gives a measure of how much a given agent is loading the Consul servers. Currently, this is only generated by agents in client mode, not Consul servers.
Increments whenever a Consul agent in client mode makes an RPC request to a Consul server and fails

The p95 time for how long it takes to service the given HTTP request for the given verb and path. Paths do not include details like service or key names, for these an underscore will be present as a placeholder (eg. consul.http.GET.v1.kv._)

The avg time for how long it takes to service the given HTTP request for the given verb and path. Paths do not include details like service or key names, for these an underscore will be present as a placeholder (eg. consul.http.GET.v1.kv._)
The number of samples of consul.http.get.v1.kv..

The max time for how long it takes to service the given HTTP request for the given verb and path. Paths do not include details like service or key names, for these an underscore will be present as a placeholder (eg. consul.http.GET.v1.kv._)

The median time for how long it takes to service the given HTTP request for the given verb and path. Paths do not include details like service or key names, for these an underscore will be present as a placeholder (eg. consul.http.GET.v1.kv._)

This tracks how long it takes to service the given HTTP request for the given verb and path. Paths do not include details like service or key names, for these an underscore will be present as a placeholder (eg. consul.http.GET.v1.kv._)

This metric counts the number of times the agent has performed failure detection on another agent at a slower probe rate. The agent uses its own health metric as an indicator to perform this action. (If its health score is low, means that the node is healthy, and vice versa.)
The p95 for the number of gossips (messages) broadcasted to a set of randomly selected nodes.
The avg for the number of gossips (messages) broadcasted to a set of randomly selected nodes.
The number of samples of consul.memberlist.gossip
The max for the number of gossips (messages) broadcasted to a set of randomly selected nodes.
The median for the number of gossips (messages) broadcasted to a set of randomly selected nodes.

This metric describes a node's perception of its own health based on how well it is meeting the soft real-time requirements of the protocol. This metric ranges from 0 to 8, where 0 indicates "totally healthy". This health score is used to scale the time between outgoing probes, and higher scores translate into longer probing intervals. For more details see section IV of the Lifeguard paper: https://arxiv.org/pdf/1707.00788.pdf
This metric counts the number of alive agents, that the agent has mapped out so far, based on the message information given by the network layer.
This metric counts the number of times an agent has marked another agent to be a dead node.

This increments when an agent suspects another as failed when executing random probes as part of the gossip protocol. These can be an indicator of overloaded agents, network problems, or configuration errors where agents can not connect to each other on the required ports.
This metric counts the number of alive agents, that the agent has mapped out so far, based on the message information given by the network layer.
This metric gives the number of dead agents, that the agent has mapped out so far, based on the message information given by the network layer.
The p95 for the time taken to perform a single round of failure detection on a select agent.
The avg for the time taken to perform a single round of failure detection on a select agent.
The number of samples of consul.memberlist.probenode
The max for the time taken to perform a single round of failure detection on a select agent.
The median for the time taken to perform a single round of failure detection on a select agent.
The p95 for the number of agents that have exchanged state with this agent.
The avg for the number of agents that have exchanged state with this agent.
The number of samples of consul.memberlist.pushpullnode
The max for the number of agents that have exchanged state with this agent.
The median for the number of agents that have exchanged state with this agent.
This metric counts the number of times an agent has accepted an incoming TCP stream connection.
This metric counts the number of times an agent has initiated a push/pull sync with an other agent.
This metric measures the total number of bytes sent by an agent through the TCP protocol
This metric measures the total number of bytes sent/received by an agent through the UDP protocol.
This metric measures the total number of bytes sent/received by an agent through the UDP protocol.
The p95 for the number of nanoseconds consumed by stop-the-world garbage collection (GC) pauses since Consul started.
The avg for the number of nanoseconds consumed by stop-the-world garbage collection (GC) pauses since Consul started.
The numer of samples of consul.runtime.gc_pause_ns
The max for the number of nanoseconds consumed by stop-the-world garbage collection (GC) pauses since Consul started.
The median for the number of nanoseconds consumed by stop-the-world garbage collection (GC) pauses since Consul started.

This increments when an agent processes an event. Consul uses events internally so there may be additional events showing in telemetry. There are also a per-event counters emitted as consul.serf.events..
This increments when an agent is marked dead. This can be an indicator of overloaded agents, network problems, or configuration errors where agents cannot connect to each other on the required ports.

Available in Consul 0.7 and later, this increments when an agent is marked dead and then recovers within a short time period. This can be an indicator of overloaded agents, network problems, or configuration errors where agents cannot connect to each other on the required ports.
This increments when an agent joins the cluster. If an agent flapped or failed this counter also increments when it re-joins.
This increments when an agent leaves the cluster.
The p95 of the time taken by the Consul agent to append an entry into the existing log.
The avg of the time taken by the Consul agent to append an entry into the existing log.
The number of samples of consul.serf.snapshot.appendline
The max of the time taken by the Consul agent to append an entry into the existing log.
The median of the time taken by the Consul agent to append an entry into the existing log.
The p95 of the time taken by the Consul agent to compact a log. This operation occurs only when the snapshot becomes large enough to justify the compaction .
The avg of the time taken by the Consul agent to compact a log. This operation occurs only when the snapshot becomes large enough to justify the compaction .
The number of samples of consul.serf.snapshot.compact
The max of the time taken by the Consul agent to compact a log. This operation occurs only when the snapshot becomes large enough to justify the compaction .
The median of the time taken by the Consul agent to compact a log. This operation occurs only when the snapshot becomes large enough to justify the compaction .
